ygData.subject: Re: Bard Weapons
ygData.msgSnippet: There s already a DoT song like this... Anyone ever HEARD Sartori sing? Dendall, Ollave of the Soerbaird http://www.soerbaird.com ... From: James Kim
ygData.messageBody:
There's already a DoT song like this... Anyone ever HEARD Sartori sing?

Dendall, Ollave of the Soerbaird
http://www.soerbaird.com

-----Original Message-----
From: James Kim [mailto:bumbler123@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 1:13 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Weapons


From: James Kim <bumbler123@...>

Germ Infested Mask
Worn on the face.
Effects: -5000 charisma
When you try to sing a song at a creature, the germs in the mask go
into your throat, causing you to hack uncontrollably. This in turn
causes major blobs of mucus to fly out of your mouth all over the
creature, poisoning it, while slowing it down to an eventual stop, once
the mucus dries into boogers which holds the monster still. You then
can go up to it and hack away with your sword.

Just my 120904902349304239403 pp

--- Roop Dirump <roop@...> wrote:
> From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
>
> Just Fantisizing,
> Feel free to add your own:
>
> ------------
>
> Giant Dervish Tuning Fork
> Uses 2H Blunt Skill
> 13 31
> Wt: 10.0
> Tuning Fork
> Race: Human, Woods Elf, Half Elf
> Class: Bard
> Magic: Can occasionally cast Chords of Dissonance in
> combat at the range of
> a: RND DMG / L 13-31 CHR:100 bard equivelent
> Gotten off a Hill or Sand Giant, Dervish Type. The
> Giant Dervish's
> instrument's are of such huge size they are of
> little use, and abandoned
> with the bodies usually. However some smiths of the
> gigantic races have
> fashioned Tuning Forks, far too unwieldy as a weapon
> by anyone but bards,
> whom by some divine ability can swing the things
> with the skill only a
> musician can wield. Foreign by the way it is
> weighted so heavily in the
> bottom area, near the fist, ordinary practioner's of
> bashing skill find it
> crude and ackward. However, in the hands of a bard,
> innate musical
> abilities give these individuals the power to swing
> it as a weapon, each
> strike an ominously deadly chrous of a truly
> deafening melody.
> (:::The item has a high damage value, for the
> weapon is only valuable
> as a "last ditch" weapon, the inherent spell effect
> of the weapon a
> detriment in everyday hunting, most bards still
> relying on dual wield or
> instruments:::)
>
> *
>
> Unicorn Horn Scimitar
> Uses 1H Slash (using resource Glowing Unicorn Horn,
> only gives L Lightstone
> light)
> 6 27
> WT: 1.4
> Unicorn Horn
> Race: Any
> Class: Brd, Pal, Ran, War
> Magic: Casts a Greater Lightstone glow, combat Hymn
> of Restoration
>
> Only made from a smith with the average ability to
> create banded, using the
> "Glowing Unicorn Horn" and sufficient ore to fashion
> a handle. This Horn
> can only be found on the corpse of a Unicorn's
> natural enemy, the Trickster.
> Slaughtering (and not through predation) a unicorn
> for it's horn is an evil
> act, and such evil goes into her horn itself, making
> that resource (Dark
> Unicorn Horn) capable of making up an entirely
> different weapon. The soul
> of the unicorn itself can come from glowing yet
> still living horn, the
> weapon virtually weightless (but for the smith's
> handle) and depending on
> the wielder's Charisma, there is a random chance for
> Hymn of Restoration at
> the level 14 Bard equivelent upon each swing of the
> weapon.
>
> *
>
> Dark Horn
> Piercing (Using resource Dark Unicorn Horn, 15 Wt)
> 7 29
> WT: 8
> Unicorn Horn
> Race: Any
> Class: Brd, Thv, Shd, War
> Magic: +60 Hide, +40 Sneak
> Unusually heavy in one's hand, with straps of thick,
> polished leather to
> give it grip, the thing actually makes a sphere of
> darkness around itself.
> Created weapon by a tailor of the reinforced
> ability, along with sufficient
> hides and a Dark Unicorn Horn. Chopped from a
> freshly slain unicorn,
> slughtered--harvested only for her horn itself: No
> matter who holds it, the
> weight of the act follows the item like a consuming
> cloud, regardless any
> virtue of the new owner. The item itself is white,
> but heavy, and eerily
> always in shadow. So much so, an individual can
> hold out the horn and step
> behind it, becoming virtually hidden from view.
> (::: The skill bonuses will not have any
> effect unless one has
> actually learned the basics of either Hiding or
> Sneak:::)
>
>
> Just hoping for bard weapons, sorry they're only
> made-up
> Roop
>
>
